remarks.para: May be inoperative provided stabilizer trim position is properly set before each departure for the actual aircraft weight, center of gravity and takeoff thrust setting.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
Steps 1, 2 and 3 are accomplished only at initial time of Nose Gear Pressure Switch deferral and does not need to be accomplished on subsequent flights with this item deferred.

numlitem.para: The Captain and Load Supervisor will confirm Automated Scales were used for weighing the containers.

note.para: If Automated Scales were not used, the aircraft load must be removed and reweighed.

numlitem.para: The Captain and Load Supervisor will visually verify all Main Deck container numbers and positions match the Load Plan.
The Captain and Load Supervisor will visually verify the correct container numbers in door position of both forward and aft lower cargo compartments.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Capt’s and F/O’s stabilizer trim indicator: "NOSE GEAR PRESS SW INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: STAB GREENBAND status level (and advisory level) message indicates that the nose gear pressure switch disagrees with the selected greenband, or an invalid CG has been entered into the MCDU. Invalid CG values are CG < 8.5 or CG > 33.0. If the message is due to an invalid CG input, the greenband indications on the Stabilizer Trim Indicators will not be illuminated. If the message is due to disagreement between the Nose Pressure Switch and the selected greenband, either the NOSE UP or NOSE DOWN greenband indications will be illuminated.
